title: Move qute-web to Quarkus core

labels.name: area/housekeeping
labels.description: Issue type for generalized tasks not related to bugs or enhancements

body:
### Description

Currently [qute-web](https://github.com/quarkiverse/quarkus-qute-web) is part of the platform but it is located in the quarkiverse.

After discussing it with @maxandersen, it seems that it would be better to have it in Quarkus core. This comes from the fact that using a quarkiverse group-id for such a core documented feature feels weird.

See https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/39953 for context. This also have been discussed here: 
https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/35739


Another point that was mentioned is the fact that `qute-http` might be a better name as it's can be used for json, xml, txt, ... and qute-web might be reducing it to "only for web app".
